name: Kepler-207
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-207 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-207 is a star with 2.059999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.59 times its radius. It is located 2929.53 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-207 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-207 b

Kepler-207 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1.61 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-207.

The mass of Kepler-207 b is 2.84 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-207 b is 1.57 that of Earth. At 2.84 Earth masses, Kepler-207 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-207 c

Kepler-207 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.07 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-207.

The mass of Kepler-207 c is 2.55 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-207 c is 1.5 that of Earth. At 2.55 Earth masses, Kepler-207 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-207 d

Kepler-207 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.87 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-207.

The mass of Kepler-207 d is 16.97 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-207 d is 3.31 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-207 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-207, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
